articles.description: All the latest football news plus reaction to Tuesday's EFL Cup third-round ties and the Women's Nations League.
articles.title: Women's Nations League & EFL Cup reaction

articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC radio commentary from the County Championship as Surrey need two more points for the title.
articles.title: County Championship: Surrey need two points for title

articles.description: Manchester United winger Antony has flown back to England from Brazil and will meet with Greater Manchester Police to answer questions about the serious allegations made against him.
articles.title: Antony to speak with police after returning to England

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says he was left in tears after a video message from caddie Harry Diamond was played at Monday's Ryder Cup Team Europe meeting.
articles.title: McIlroy's 'tears' after caddie Diamond's video

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has admitted he has failed to get the best out of Kalvin Phillips since signing him from Leeds United.
articles.title: I've failed to get best out of Phillips - Guardiola

articles.description: Since Todd Boehly became chairman, Chelsea have spent £185m on buying players from Brighton - as well as taking seven members of their staff. Has it worked out?
articles.title: How have Chelsea's Brighton moves worked out?

articles.description: Victor Osimhen's agent Roberto Calenda says they could take legal action against Napoli after the club mocked the striker in a video on social media.
articles.title: Osimhen agent threatens legal action against Napoli

articles.description: Johnny Matthews is "buzzing" about his call-up to the Scotland World Cup squad and with a first cap aged 30 on the horizon.
articles.title: Try-scoring sensation Matthews on Scotland call-up

articles.description: England captain Millie Bright says it is "mind-blowing" that the video assistant referee was not used in their Women's Nations League defeat by the Netherlands.
articles.title: No VAR in England loss is 'mind-blowing' - Bright

articles.description: Worcestershire pick up the final point needed against Yorkshire at Headingley to secure promotion back to Division One.
articles.title: Worcestershire seal promotion back to Division One
